uk.org.taverna.server.client
Class Run

java.lang.Object
  uk.org.taverna.server.client.Run

public final class Run
extends java.lang.Object

The Run class represents a workflow run on a Taverna Server instance. It is created by supplying a Server instance on which to create it and a workflow to be run.

Author:
Robert Haines

uploadData

public java.net.URI uploadData(byte[] data,
                               java.lang.String remoteName,
                               java.lang.String remoteDirectory)
Upload data to a file in this Run instance's workspace on the server.

Parameters:
data - The data to upload.
remoteName - The name of the file to save the data in on the server.
remoteDirectory - The directory within the workspace in which to save the data. This directory must already exist.
Returns:
the URI of the uploaded data on the remote server.

Parameters:

Returns:

isBaclavaInput

public boolean isBaclavaInput()
Is this run using baclava to set all its input ports?

Returns:
true if yes, false if not.

isBaclavaOutput

public boolean isBaclavaOutput()
Is this run using baclava to return all its output port data?

Returns:
true if yes, false if not.

requestBaclavaOutput

public void requestBaclavaOutput()
Set the server to return outputs for this Run in baclava format. This must be set before the Run is started.

getBaclavaOutput

public byte[] getBaclavaOutput()
Get the outputs of this Run as a baclava formatted document. The Run must have been set to output in baclava format before it is started.

Returns:
The baclava formatted document contents as a byte array.
See Also:
requestBaclavaOutput(), getBaclavaOutputStream(), writeBaclavaOutputToFile(File)

getBaclavaOutputStream

public java.io.InputStream getBaclavaOutputStream()
Get an input stream that can be used to stream the baclava output data of this run. The Run must have been set to output in baclava format before it is started. Note: You are responsible for closing the stream once you have finished with it. Not doing so may prevent further use of the underlying network connection.

Returns:
The stream to read the baclava data from.
See Also:
getBaclavaOutput(), writeBaclavaOutputToFile(File), requestBaclavaOutput()

writeBaclavaOutputToFile

public void writeBaclavaOutputToFile(java.io.File file)
                              throws java.io.IOException
Writes the baclava output data of this run directly to a file. The data is not loaded into memory, it is streamed directly to the file. The file is created if it does not already exist and will overwrite existing data if it does. The Run must have been set to output in baclava format before it is started.

Parameters:
file - the file to write to.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened for any other reason.
java.io.IOException - if there is any I/O error.
See Also:
getBaclavaOutput(), getBaclavaOutputStream(), requestBaclavaOutput()

getIdentifier

public java.lang.String getIdentifier()
Get the id of this run.

Returns:
the id of this run.

getOwner

public java.lang.String getOwner()
Get the owner of this run.

Returns:
the username of the owner of this run.

isOwner

public boolean isOwner()
Are the credentials being used to access this run those of the owner? The owner of the run can give other users certain access rights to their runs but only the owner can change these rights - or even see what they are. Sometimes it is useful to know if the user accessing the run is actually the owner of it or not.

Returns:
whether the user credentials of this Run instance are those of the owner of the run as the remote server understands it.

getStatus

public RunStatus getStatus()
Get the status of this Run.

Returns:
the status of this Run.

public boolean isInitialized()
Is this Run initialized?

Returns:
true if the Run is initialized, false otherwise.

public boolean isRunning()
Is this Run running?

Returns:
true if the Run is running, false otherwise.

isFinished

public boolean isFinished()
Is this Run finished?

Returns:
true if the Run is finished, false otherwise.

           throws java.io.IOException

getPermissions

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,RunPermission> getPermissions()
Get all the permissions set for this run. Only the owner of a run may query its permissions.

Returns:
a map of username to permission for each user.
Throws:
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.
See Also:
RunPermission}

getPermission

public RunPermission getPermission(java.lang.String username)
Return the permission granted to user for this run, if any. Only the owner of a run may query its permissions.

Parameters:
username - The username of the user to query.
Returns:
the permission the user has been granted, if any.
Throws:
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.
See Also:
RunPermission}

setPermission

public java.net.URI setPermission(java.lang.String username,
                                  RunPermission permission)
Grant the specified user the stated permission. To revoke a permission for a user, simply set the permission for that user to RunPermission.NONE or null. Only the owner of a run may grant or revoke permissions on it.

Parameters:
username - The user to grant permissions to.
permission - The permission to grant.
Returns:
the URI of the created permission resource on the server.
Throws:
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.
See Also:
RunPermission}

getServiceCredentials

public java.util.Map<java.net.URI,java.net.URI> getServiceCredentials()
Get all the credentials that have been provided for this run. Only the owner of a run may query credentials that have been provided for it.

Returns:
A Map of service URI to credential resource URI.
Throws:
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.

getServiceCredential

public java.net.URI getServiceCredential(java.net.URI serviceURI)
Get the credential resource URI that Taverna Server is using to provide credentials for the supplied service URI.

Parameters:
serviceURI - The service URI to query.
Returns:
The credential resource that is being used for the specified service URI.
Throws:
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.

setServiceCredential

public java.net.URI setServiceCredential(java.net.URI serviceURI,
                                         java.lang.String username,
                                         java.lang.String password)
Provide a username and password credential for the secure service at the specified URI. Only the owner of a run may supply credentials for it.

Parameters:
serviceURI - The URI of the service that this credential is for.
username - The username of this credential.
password - The password of this credential.
Returns:
The URI to the credential resource on the remote Taverna Server.
Throws:
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.

setServiceCredential

public java.net.URI setServiceCredential(java.net.URI serviceURI,
                                         java.io.File keypair,
                                         java.lang.String password)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
Provide a client certificate credential for the secure service at the specified URI. You will need to provide the password to unlock the private key. Only the owner of a run may supply credentials for it.

Parameters:
serviceURI - The URI of the service that this credential is for.
keypair - The file with the credential in it.
password - The password to unlock the credential.
Returns:
The URI to the credential resource on the remote Taverna Server.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was a problem reading the credential file.
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.

setServiceCredential

public java.net.URI setServiceCredential(java.net.URI serviceURI,
                                         java.io.InputStream keypair,
                                         java.lang.String password)
Provide a client certificate credential for the secure service at the specified URI. You will need to provide the password to unlock the private key.

Parameters:
serviceURI - The URI of the service that this credential is for.
keypair - The stream with the credential in it.
password - The password to unlock the credential.
Returns:
The URI to the credential resource on the remote Taverna Server.
Throws:
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.

deleteServiceCredential

public boolean deleteServiceCredential(java.net.URI serviceURI)
Delete the credential that has been provided for the specified service. Only the owner of a run may delete its credentials.

Parameters:
serviceURI - The service for which to delete the credential.
Returns:
true if the operation succeeded, false otherwise.
Throws:
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.

deleteAllServiceCredentials

public boolean deleteAllServiceCredentials()
Delete all credentials associated with this workflow run. Only the owner of a run may delete its credentials.

Returns:
true if the operation succeeded, false otherwise.
Throws:
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.

getTrustedIdentities

public java.util.List<java.net.URI> getTrustedIdentities()
Return a list of all the URIs of trusted identities (for example, a server public key for peer verification) that have been registered for this run. At present there is no way to differentiate between trusted identities without noting the URI returned when originally uploaded. Only the owner of a run may query its trusted identities.

Returns:
the list of trusted identities registered for this run.
Throws:
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.

setTrustedIdentity

public java.net.URI setTrustedIdentity(java.io.File certificate)
                                throws java.io.IOException
Add a trusted identity (server public key) to verify peers when using https connections to Web Services. The URI of the trusted identity on the server is returned. Only the owner of a run may add a trusted identity.

Parameters:
certificate - The public key file to use as a trusted identity.
Returns:
The URI of the uploaded trusted identity resource.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the specified file cannot be opened for any reason.
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.

setTrustedIdentity

public java.net.URI setTrustedIdentity(java.io.InputStream certificate)
Add a trusted identity (server public key) to verify peers when using https connections to Web Services. The URI of the trusted identity on the server is returned. Only the owner of a run may add a trusted identity.

Parameters:
certificate - The public key to use as a trusted identity.
Returns:
The URI of the uploaded trusted identity resource.
Throws:
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.

deleteTrustedIdentity

public boolean deleteTrustedIdentity(java.net.URI uri)
Delete the trusted identity resource at the specified URI from the remote server. Only the owner of a run may delete a trusted identity.

Parameters:
uri - The URI of the trusted identity to delete.
Returns:
true on success, false otherwise.
Throws:
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.

deleteAllTrustedIdentities

public boolean deleteAllTrustedIdentities()
Delete all of the trusted identities that have been registered for use by this run. Only the owner of a run may delete trusted identities.

Returns:
true on success, false otherwise.
Throws:
IllegalUserAccessException - if the credentials in this Run are not the owner's.

getOutputZipStream

public java.io.InputStream getOutputZipStream()
Get an input stream that can be used to stream all the output data of this run in zip format. Note: You are responsible for closing the stream once you have finished with it. Not doing so may prevent further use of the underlying network connection.

Returns:
The stream to read the zip data from.
See Also:
writeOutputToZipFile(File)

writeOutputToZipFile

public void writeOutputToZipFile(java.io.File file)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Writes all the output data of this run directly to a file in zip format. The data is not loaded into memory, it is streamed directly to the file. The file is created if it does not already exist and will overwrite existing data if it does.

Parameters:
file - the file to write to.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file exists but is a directory rather than a regular file, does not exist but cannot be created, or cannot be opened for any other reason.
java.io.IOException - if there is any I/O error.
See Also:
getOutputZipStream()

mkdir

public java.net.URI mkdir(java.lang.String dir)
Create a directory in the workspace of this Run. At present you can only create a directory one level deep.

Parameters:
dir - the name of the directory to create.
Returns:
the URI of the created directory.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an attempt to create a directory more than one level deep is made.
